title: Jurgen Klopp sweating on fitness of two Liverpool stars ahead of Man United clash
text:
GETTY Jurgen Klopp is hoping Joel Matip and Jordan Henderson are fit for Sunday 
The pair returned to training yesterday at the club’s Melwood base to give them hope of featuring at Old Trafford. 
They will be assessed today to see if they have suffered any reaction from the session. 
If neither suffers any issues then they could return against United which would be a huge boost for Kop boss Jurgen Klopp. 
Reds skipper Henderson, 26, has not played since the New Year’s Eve win over Manchester City . This is the note Jurgen Klopp passed to Daniel Sturridge Wednesday, 11th January 2017 DANIEL STURRIDGE was handed instructions on a piece of paper from the Liverpool bench during the EFL Cup defeat to Southampton. 1 / 8 Liverpool FC via Getty Images Daniel Sturridge was handed instructions on a piece of paper from the Liverpool bench 
GETTY Joel Matip could return from injury for Liverpool “He’s a top player and every team in the world would miss him” James Milner on Liverpool star Philippe Coutinho 
The England midfielder was substituted in the second half of the game with a heel problem. 
Defender Matip has not played since Liverpool ’s 2-2 draw with West Ham on December 11. 
The Cameroon international had been trying to manage an ankle injury picked up in November, but has missed the whole Christmas period and start to the New Year. 
Fellow summer signing Ragnar Klavan has deputised in recent weeks, but was at fault for Nathan Redmond’s winner in Wednesday’s 1-0 defeat by Southampton in the EFL Cup semi-final first leg. 
Kop forward Philippe Coutinho returned as a second-half substitute in that game at St Mary’s after almost seven weeks out with an ankle injury and the Brazil ace is set to start against United. 
Liverpool utility man James Milner believes the returning Kop ace can restore the attacking flair in Jurgen Klopp’s side. 
The Reds have failed to score in back-to-back games after also being held to a goalless draw by League Two Plymouth in the FA Cup on Sunday. 
It is the first time since January of last year that the Reds have failed to score two games in a row. 
GETTY Jordan Henderson has not played since Liverpool beat Man City 
Milner said: “He’s a top player and every team in the world would miss him. 
“It’s not easy when you’ve been out that long still thinking about the injury so it was positive for him to get some minutes. 
“The more he plays, the more influential he will be for us again.” Related articles
